content: be sure to check off each date as completed note for a 365 day year it is necessary to knit 4 extra row to make panel 3 the same length as panels 1 and 2 in a leap year there are 366 days which divides equally by 3… so it is not necessary to knit extra row before binding off verify that panel 3 has the same number of garter stitch ridges as panels 1 and 2 on the 4th row of day #365 or 366 with wrong side of knitting facing bind off loosely knitwise 3 all kinds of weather - blanket knitting pattern design by fifty four ten studio © 2024 finishing instructions 1 weave in ends on the wrong side of the blanket work horizontally across at least 2 of garter stitch ridge the ends will be most hidden when weaving in across the matching yarn color it s helpful to occasionally thread the needle through the yarn of the stitches to create some gauge between the fibers work across about 2 - 3 of stitches and then snip the yarn leaving about 1/4 of yarn then use the tip of the tapestry needle to fray separate the strands of yarn the 1/4 of yarn to help discourage the yarn from slipping out for more info see my blog post about weaving in ends bit ly/weavinginendsgarterstitch5410 2 wet block the three panels this makes a big improvement on the appearance of the knitting see step-by-step blocking tips on my website bit ly/howtoblockknittingblog 3 baste the panels together neatly arrange the three panels on the floor or large table using the diagram on page 5 as a guide arrange panels carefully so corners match up evenly starting at the cast on edges count 20 garter stitch ridges and then use 8 pieces of yarn and tapestry needle to baste panels together where the garter stitch ridges match up tie a knot in each basting yarn to temporarily hold panels in place count the next 20 garter stitch ridges and baste at that point repeat until the panels are loosely held together with basting yarn 4 sew up seams with mattress stitch with right side of knitting facing and starting at top of blanket sew up seam between panels 1 and 2 using a tapestry needle and an 18 piece of neutral colored yarn feed tapestry needle through edge stitches one at a time alternating from one panel to the other remove basting yarns as complete each section of the seam as needed join another 18 piece of yarn use same technique to seam panels 2 and 3 together if you have any questions contact mary lee at fiftyfourtenstudio@gmail com visit my website and shop my knitting patterns fiftyfourtenstudio com shop all of my knitting patterns on ravelry bit ly/5410studioravelry most of my knitting patterns are available in my etsy shop sign up for my email newsletter here bit ly/5410studionewslettersignup follow me on facebook and instagram @fiftyfourtenstudio all content
